bill_title: require a landowner to apply to the director of equalization and to request the use of the marshland soils rating classification to value certain agricultural land.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require a landowner to apply to the director of equalization and to request the use of the marshland soils rating classification to value certain agricultural land. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-6-33.21 be amended to read as follows: 10-6-33.21. The If an application is submitted pursuant to section 2 of this act, the director of equalization shall take into consideration and make adjustments in setting the assessed value for agricultural land which has been inundated by floods and is not farmable during the past three growing seasons. The director of equalization shall use the marshland soils rating classification pursuant to § § 10-6-33.2 and 10-6-33.7 to determine the assessed value of the acreage inundated and not farmable. Section 2. That chapter 10-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If agricultural land has been inundated by floods and was not farmable during the past three growing seasons, a person may request the director of equalization to specially assess the land for the purpose of taxation by submitting an application before August first. The owner shall describe on the application the portion of the agricultural land that has been inundated by floods and was not farmable during the past three growing seasons.

bill_versions.bill_version: Senate Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require a landowner to apply to the director of equalization and to request the use of the marshland soils rating classification to value certain agricultural land. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-6-33.21 be amended to read as follows: 10-6-33.21. The If an application is submitted pursuant to section 2 of this act, the director of equalization shall take into consideration and make adjustments in setting the assessed value for agricultural land which has been inundated by floods and is not farmable during the past three growing seasons. The director of equalization shall use the marshland soils rating classification pursuant to § § 10-6-33.2 and 10-6-33.7 to determine the assessed value of the acreage inundated and not farmable. Section 2. That chapter 10-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If agricultural land has been inundated by floods and was not farmable during the past three growing seasons, a person may request the director of equalization to specially assess the land for the purpose of taxation by submitting an application before November first. The owner shall describe on the application the portion of the agricultural land that has been inundated by floods and was not farmable during the past three growing seasons. BILL HISTORY 1/25/99 First read in Senate and referred to Agriculture and Natural Resources. S.J. 176 1/28/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/28/99 Agriculture and Natural Resources Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 8, NAYS 0. S.J. 230 1/28/99 Agriculture and Natural Resources Place on Consent Calendar.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require a landowner to apply to the director of equalization and to request the use of the marshland soils rating classification to value certain agricultural land. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-6-33.21 be amended to read as follows: 10-6-33.21. The If an application is submitted pursuant to section 2 of this act, the director of equalization shall take into consideration and make adjustments in setting the assessed value for agricultural land which has been inundated by floods and is not farmable during the past three growing seasons. The director of equalization shall use the marshland soils rating classification pursuant to § § 10-6-33.2 and 10-6-33.7 to determine the assessed value of the acreage inundated and not farmable. Section 2. That chapter 10-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If agricultural land has been inundated by floods and was not farmable during the past three growing seasons, any landowner or the landowner's agent or attorney may request the director of equalization to specially assess the land for the purpose of taxation by submitting an application before November first. The landowner or the landowner's agent or attorney shall describe on the application the portion of the agricultural land that has been inundated by floods and was not farmable during the past three growing seasons. BILL HISTORY 1/25/99 First read in Senate and referred to Agriculture and Natural Resources. S.J. 176 1/28/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/28/99 Agriculture and Natural Resources Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 8, NAYS 0. S.J. 230 1/28/99 Agriculture and Natural Resources Place on Consent Calendar. 2/2/99 Motion to Amend, Passed. S.J. 301 2/2/99 Senate Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 33, NAYS 0. S.J. 301
